title: Augusta County: A. Waddill to J. H. McCue, January 29, 1859
summary: Waddill discusses the profitability of publishing a newspaper and feels that McCue lives in a "wealth section of country, and that a paper could succeed well there." Waddill added that he thinks "a neutral paper would succeed better than a political one, but I am Whig to the core."
keywords: Economy, National Government, State Government, American Civil War
